page.title: 05 WHITLEY BAY GOLF COURSE.
page.content: Is situated to the N.W. of Whitley Bay on what was formerly open-cast mining land. The Golf Club was started in 1890 and will celebrate its centenary in 1990. The course is 129 acres in extent with 18 holes each 4 inches deep. The greens are cut 3 times a week and the fairways once, the rough areas are allowed to grow naturally within reason. There is 1 secretary and 4 full-time greenkeepers. The club has a shop, lounge and restaurant. Players can play from 6:00a.m. until darkness. There are 645 members, 375 men, 170 ladies and 100 juniors. The youngest member is 10 and the oldest is 85. A maximum of 72 players can be on the course at any one time- 4 per hole. The course is open all year apart from competition days and when weather stops play.
